tweet: Don't give me your opinion on Ethereum until you  - Open an argent wallet - Send DAI using InstaPay - Lend ETH using compound - Take out a Maker CDP - Trade something on Uniswap  Most of the people with hot takes on Ethereum haven't done even one of these things

I love both BTC and ETH, it’s kind of insane to me this could be even slightly controversial, but but both Bitcoin and Ethereum are two of the most amazing things invented this century. The cognitive dissonance required to love one and hate the other is mind boggling to me.

For all the fud that is doing the rounds about Ethereum... of the hundreds of applications I receive from blockchain startups to join @techstars, 95% are building on Ethereum. There hasn’t been any significant shift to other chains in what I’m seeing on a daily basis.

$ETH watch this speculation play out over the next year...  No doubt in my mind that ETH is easily still the best blockchain for development, smart contract systems, and remaining core to the main principles of decentralization.   Nothing really comes close at the moment.  https://t.co/GQj8QPq3RH

2015-bitcoin flatlines to $175 from $1200.   2019-ethereum flatlines to $107 from $1k. bitcoin heart beats, but struggles at 50% ATH.    in background, increasing army of devs, startups, research, blockchain weeks, grass-root movement.   if you think its dead, your an idiot.

One of the best things I like about @ethereum is that its community is self-indoctrinated, passionate and focused on innovation and experimentations in “true” decentralization. They don’t care so much about the current status & are not afraid to start with a blank sheet of paper.

The main difference between #Ethereum and #Bitcoin:  $ETH: "Let's expose the flaws in public blockchains and attack them head-on."  $BTC: "Let's hide the flaws in our very first iteration of a public blockchain and pretend everything is fine. Attack any outside innovation."
